I agree that if you can do so without financial impact, you should absolutely continue to isolate until testing negative. 

But there should be no shaming people who *follow the CDC recommendations* for ending isolation; a lot of people no longer have the privilege of sufficient sick time.

talk.author: did:plc:pptrkexbcbmmgw2st4pjby75

I don't think you'll find disabled, immunocompromised folks shaming anyone for circumstances outside their control. Marginalized people don't marginalize others.

But shame has a definition and it doesn't need my help. Feeling icky when acting against your own values is a basic human right.
